chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia B Ballwanz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Huber.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

-AODA and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: To commence immediately.  Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

records.addlTxt: for Ignition Interlock Exemptions - Faxed to DOT on June 29, 2018
Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (05/10/2019)

1:04 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Hayley Pucker present in court via telephone.  Statement by defendant, was going to have paid today and states reasons why.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:06 p.m.
from Agent Hayley Pucker dated April 3, 2018 re: PRH scheduled on 04/16/2018
Probation review hearing on April 16, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Patricia B Ballwanz
Current: 178 E 2nd St, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 11-02-2016)
Prior: 176 E. 2nd St Apt 1, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States

12:07 p.m. Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - State will amend to misdemeanor OWI with probation and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Further statement by DA - will amend to 4th offense OWI as misdemeanor.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as amended to Misdemeanor OWI-4th offense.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-60 days county jail, with huber to commence immediately.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-$600 fine plus court costs.
-Blood Draw Fee $42.50
-DL revocation - 24 months
-IID - 24 months
-AODA and any follow-up(FDL)
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 12:18 p.m.
